title: Week 1: Cyber Hygiene & Passwords
description:
WEEK 1 OVERVIEW: Learn the fundamentals of cybersecurity by mastering password security and cyber hygiene best practices.

KEY TOPICS:
- Strong password creation (12+ characters, mix of upper/lower/numbers/symbols)
- Password managers (LastPass, 1Password, Bitwarden)
- Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA/2FA)
- Regular software updates
- Secure email practices

CHEAT SHEET:
1. Never reuse passwords across sites
2. Enable MFA everywhere possible
3. Use a password manager
4. Update software within 48 hours of release
5. Verify sender before clicking links

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Set up a password manager and enable 2FA on your email account.

COMPLETION BADGE: Cyber Hygiene Champion

title: Week 2: Phishing & Social Engineering
description:
WEEK 2 OVERVIEW: Understand how attackers manipulate people through phishing and social engineering tactics.

KEY TOPICS:
- Email phishing red flags (urgent language, suspicious links, spelling errors)
- Spear phishing vs mass phishing
- Vishing (voice phishing) and smishing (SMS phishing)
- Pretexting and impersonation attacks
- Business Email Compromise (BEC)

CHEAT SHEET:
1. Hover over links before clicking
2. Check sender email carefully
3. Look for HTTPS in URLs
4. Never share passwords via email/phone
5. Verify requests through separate channels
6. Be suspicious of urgency and threats

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Identify phishing emails in your inbox and report them.

COMPLETION BADGE: Phishing Detector

title: Week 3: Malware 101
description:
WEEK 3 OVERVIEW: Learn about different types of malware and how to protect against them.

KEY TOPICS:
- Virus: self-replicating malicious code
- Worm: spreads without user action
- Trojan: disguised as legitimate software
- Ransomware: encrypts files for ransom
- Spyware: steals information
- Rootkit: hides malware presence

CHEAT SHEET:
1. Keep antivirus updated
2. Don't download from untrusted sources
3. Scan USB drives before use
4. Regular backups (3-2-1 rule)
5. Avoid pirated software
6. Use application whitelisting

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Run a full system scan and review quarantined items.

COMPLETION BADGE: Malware Hunter

title: Week 4: Safe Browsing & HTTPS
description:
WEEK 4 OVERVIEW: Master secure browsing practices and understand HTTPS encryption.

KEY TOPICS:
- HTTP vs HTTPS (SSL/TLS encryption)
- Certificate authorities and trust chains
- Padlock icon meaning
- Secure vs insecure cookies
- Browser security settings
- Private/incognito mode limitations

CHEAT SHEET:
1. Only enter credentials on HTTPS sites
2. Check for valid certificates
3. Use browser extensions (HTTPS Everywhere, uBlock Origin)
4. Clear cookies regularly
5. Disable third-party cookies
6. Enable Do Not Track

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Install HTTPS Everywhere and audit your saved passwords.

COMPLETION BADGE: Secure Surfer

title: Week 5: OSI & TCP/IP Quick Tour
description:
WEEK 5 OVERVIEW: Understand network fundamentals through the OSI model and TCP/IP stack.

KEY TOPICS:
- OSI 7 layers (Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application)
- TCP/IP 4 layers
- Encapsulation and de-encapsulation
- TCP (reliable) vs UDP (fast)
- Three-way handshake
- Common protocols by layer

CHEAT SHEET:
Layer 1-Physical: Cables, hubs
Layer 2-Data Link: Switches, MAC addresses
Layer 3-Network: Routers, IP addresses
Layer 4-Transport: TCP/UDP, ports
Layer 5-7: Applications (HTTP, FTP, DNS)

TCP: Connection-oriented, reliable
UDP: Connectionless, fast

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Use 'netstat' command to view active connections.

COMPLETION BADGE: Network Navigator

title: Week 6: Ports & Services
description:
WEEK 6 OVERVIEW: Learn about network ports and common services that run on them.

KEY TOPICS:
- Port numbers (0-65535 range)
- Well-known ports (0-1023)
- Registered ports (1024-49151)
- Common service ports
- Port scanning basics
- Service banner grabbing

CHEAT SHEET - CRITICAL PORTS:
20/21 - FTP (File Transfer)
22 - SSH (Secure Shell)
23 - Telnet (Insecure, avoid)
25 - SMTP (Email)
53 - DNS (Domain Name System)
80 - HTTP (Web)
443 - HTTPS (Secure Web)
3306 - MySQL Database
3389 - RDP (Remote Desktop)

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Use 'netstat -an' to see listening ports on your system.

COMPLETION BADGE: Port Master

title: Week 7: Firewalls & NAT
description:
WEEK 7 OVERVIEW: Understand how firewalls protect networks and NAT conserves IP addresses.

KEY TOPICS:
- Packet filtering firewalls
- Stateful vs stateless firewalls
- Application layer firewalls (WAF)
- NAT (Network Address Translation)
- PAT (Port Address Translation)
- Firewall rules and policies
- DMZ (Demilitarized Zone)

CHEAT SHEET:
Firewall Types:
1. Packet Filter: Checks IP/port
2. Stateful: Tracks connections
3. Proxy: Intermediary
4. Next-Gen: Deep packet inspection

NAT Benefits:
- IP address conservation
- Internal network hiding
- Basic security layer

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Check Windows Firewall rules or configure router firewall.

COMPLETION BADGE: Firewall Guardian

title: Week 8: Wireshark Basics
description:
WEEK 8 OVERVIEW: Learn packet analysis fundamentals using Wireshark network analyzer.

KEY TOPICS:
- Packet capture basics
- Wireshark interface overview
- Display filters vs capture filters
- Following TCP streams
- Protocol hierarchy
- Analyzing HTTP traffic
- Finding suspicious activity

CHEAT SHEET - WIRESHARK FILTERS:
ip.addr == 192.168.1.1 (Specific IP)
tcp.port == 80 (HTTP traffic)
http (All HTTP)
http.request.method == "GET" (GET requests)
dns (DNS queries)
tcp.flags.syn == 1 (SYN packets)

Analysis Tips:
1. Start with Protocol Hierarchy
2. Use Statistics > Conversations
3. Follow TCP Stream for full sessions
4. Export objects for file downloads

PRACTICAL EXERCISE: Capture and analyze your own web browsing traffic.

COMPLETION BADGE: Packet Detective

title: Week 9: Intro to Nmap
description: Host discovery and port scanning ethics.

title: Week 24: Intro to Reverse Engineering
description: Static vs dynamic, strings, basic tools.

title: Week 51: Final Review & Boss Prep
description: Consolidate knowledge for the final boss.
